More Half-Life, what more do you want?

You can play Half-Life 2 any way you want, as long as it's exactly the very way developers decided you should. Railroading was common in base game too, but it got much worse in Episode 1, to point where I just don't feel like playing any further.

Also, the "One Free Bullet" achievement is really hard.

Half-Life 2: Episode One is the weakest Half-Life game in the series. It can be completed in about 2.5hrs, and probably faster if you're familiar with the levels. 

The game starts with you infiltrating the Citadel and you are given a gravity gun upgrade pretty early. It makes killing the combine super easy, but ultimately cheapens the combat. There's little reason to use anything other than the blue gravity gun. It's a fun power trip, but thankfully is taken away from the player after the chapter is over.

My favorite chapter is Lowlife; you fight through a parking garage, making your way to the city streets. Parts of the mission is spent in the dark, so you must use the flashlight and flares to navigate. You must manage HEV suit power and flares so you are not left in the dark during a battle.

I really didn't like the surface chapters. Open areas felt like a cheap Hollywood set and lack the depth of Half-Life 2. I know this isn't engine limitations, because some of the areas in the Urban Flight chapter did a good job at using perspective trickery to convincingly portray City 17. Also, Hal-Life 2 had terrific map design.

I recommend this game because you only have one more episode before everything comes to an abrupt screeching halt. Enjoy it while you can.
A decent continuation of the original Half-Life 2.

The odd middle child of HL2 and its expansions.

I NEVER see anybody mention this game nor do I see many people even having it with them unless they wanted to play all of the Half Life franchise or had the VCP or Orange Box.

I can see why this is. In my opinion, this game really isnt too juicy in terms of plot compared to the other 2 games in HL2 and its expansions. Only 2 things that happen in the game matter in episode 2. One thing that mattered was shown at the very end, and the other had no significance in episode one but a lot in episode 2. As long as you look up the plot and overview it briefly, youre set for HL2EP2

Pros: If you liked the City 17 war, this game pretty much revolves around it, go nuts.
The game that introduced zombine
By far the most unique in the series in terms of how antlions and zombies are used.

Cons:
Nothing really new besides zombine and more levels and Dr Kliener giving breencasts.

Would I suggest this? Yes, its half life content, but keep in mind that its totally optional to skip this and not miss out on much of episode 2s story by just googling the plot
Good, but not as good as episode 2

good game, but too short for playing

Inmediatamente despu√©s de los hechos de Half LIfe 2, contin√∫a la historia de Gordon y Alyx. En la misma l√≠nea que HL2, divertido, con buena historia (aunque me parece un poco corto este Episodio 1)
oooof. i had high hopes for this

+ Soundtrack - it is quite rare, but then it happens it's really good, it fits so well. You must experience this yourself to understand.
+ Puzzles, you need to use game physics in order to solve puzzles, while the puzzles are easy to figure them out, they are quite creative and fun.
+ Boss battles.
+ Ending is awesome, one of the better cliffhangers.
+ Achievements, this game has some achievements which creates bonus challenge. Such achievements are so great, gives aditional challenge and makes whole new experience.
+ Mod support, game has tons of fantastic mods.
+ It features almost everything best HL2 had to offer and did not include most of bad HL2 stuff. So it's best Half Life game so far, unless you prefer Episode Two


- I'm missing the secrets (item caches) HL2 levels had.
- Aux power... Why they brought this back? It sucks. How in the world does such thing even exists... It is a meter which is for running, underwater time AND flashlight at the same time... WHY???? Anyway it uses out extremely fast even if i use only one of the features. As for underwater time it's fine, but 10 second flash light and like 8 seconds sprinting is way not enough, sometimes I have to spint and use flashlight at the same time, which makes the power to drain out in 3 seconds or so... 1. Why can't all these features a have a different meter. 2. The whole recharchable flashlight mechanic is horrible and should be avoided in any game, why can't a game either have infinite flashlight or flashlight to run on batteries. Recharchable flashlight is cancer as it always runs out very quickly and you are forced to wait a few seconds for it to recharge. 3. Running really could be a bit faster and consident aux power runs out so quickly it's almost a useless feature.


8/10

Se me hizo cortito cuando mas lo comenzaba a disfrutar termina este episodio, pero es eso solo una expancion a la historia principal de half life 2, un impresindible para continuar con la historia de esta linda saga.
A very short game that follows up Half-Life 2 it added a little bit to the story but not that much.  The challenge I enjoyed doing is The One Free Bullet achievement try it out.

Half Life 2: Episode 1 continues directly where the last game left off. It is however extremely short, lacking anything unique in terms of game play other than a few new situations and uses for the gravity gun and fails to differ from the the main game. It is however more Half Life 2 and if you enjoyed that you will definitely enjoy this.
Very good game, good boss fights, good maps, but i expected the gameplay to be longer.

(btw,i love how Alyx punches zombie in a dick)
A pleasant continuation of the game!

Episode One is a nice continuation of the story of Half-Life 2. However, it isn't the greatest game ever. Don't get me wrong, episode one is great, but there are times where the game drives me crazy. Honestly, it feels like the game is only here to setup episode two. Although episode one has some problems, it is still really fun and worth the price.

Siendo sincero, siempre he considerado a Half Life Episode One como el peor Half Life, incluso m√°s que el Blue Shift, almenos Episode One es m√°s largo, esto no significa que sea un mal juego, simplemente no aporta casi nada, realmente esta parte del juego te la venden m√°s que nada porque durante todo el episodio estar√°s acompa√±ado de Alyx.

Este episodio no aporta nada importante a la historia, m√°s que decirnos que los vortigaunts saben que algo malo trama Gman, y que tenemos que retrasar la explosi√≥n de la ciudadela y huir de ah√≠. Mucho menos aporta algo al gameplay, la verdad agradezco que luego de Episode Two valve decidiera no sacar m√°s Half Life como episodios, basicamente esto demostr√≥ que sacar un Half Life al a√±o, no crear√≠a tanta especulacion y hype entre t√≠tulo, como lo fu√© la diferencia de salida entre el primero y segundo juego, tendrian menos tiempo para agregar cosas, y mucho menos mejorar graficamente, Que encima ser√≠a mucho m√°s corto no le dar√≠a buena imagen al juego, ni la empresa. 

Calidad sobre cantidad.      7.5/10
Its fun. Nice continuation of HL2. Episode 2 is better though.
Corto pero bueno te vas a divertir como siempre ;D
It's okay, part 2 is a lot better.

Direct continuation of Half Life 2, happening right after the CItadel explosion/collapse. This does very well to continue from the main game, like the 2nd DLC does to this one. Still gives the same Half Life 2 charm and experience, so don't worry about being on the fence about these DLCs.
